description: Application for Minor Material Amendment (S73) to vary Condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission ref. 178186FUL dated 18.05.2018 for Part two and three storey rear extensions and the creation of a fourth (mansard) storey to accommodate five residential units on the first, second and third floor levels with associated refuse and cycle storage on the ground floor.  Variation is seeking to increase the area of the proposed common access stair at second and third floor levels along eastern elevation to align with first floor level; to amend the internal layout of two flats to studio flats; to omit a window within the stair enclosure at first floor level; to amend size and location of access doors on north elevation including internal alterations to refuse and cycle stores; and to provide passive smoke ventilation louvre in north elevation at high level on ground floor
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of 18 May 2018.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): BR48-PP-04; and BR48-PP-03 rev A, received 31 May 2018; BR48-PP-01 rev B, received 03 August 2018; BR48-PP-02 rev B, received 03 August 2018.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Ensure the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces (including hardstanding and boundary treatments) of the development is carried out in accordance with the approved details ref. 183407CND dated 26 July 2018.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The refuse storage facilities shown on the approved plans shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details of the type of cycle storage stands to be used shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to occupation of the residential units. The approved cycle storage facilities shall be fully implemented and operational before the first occupation of the development, and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).
| The first floor side elevation windows of Flat 2 that face the Green Man Passage shall be obscured glazed at 1.7m above internal floor level and below, and shall be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 3.5 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of a ventilation strategy setting out measures for providing fresh air ventilation to the residential units facing the Broadway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to the first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of Ealing Council's Development Management Policies DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Sound insulation measures shall be provided to all habitable rooms located with a fa√ßade affected by noise emanating from the Broadway such that the measures comply with the criteria specified at Section 4, Part B (Criteria for adequate protection for new buildings) of Ealing's interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. The sound insulation measures shall be incorporated into the external building fabric, acoustically treated glazing, and other means of ventilation provided (precluding natural ventilation from open windows).
The sound mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any residential units in the relevant part of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers of the apartment building adjoining locations identified as exceeding accepted residential noise levels, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and Ealing's interim SPG10: Noise and Vibration.	 | Sound limiting insulation for all divisions (walls and/or floors) separating the approved ground floor retail use from the above and adjacent residential dwellings shall achieve at least +5dB above the Building Regulations Approved Document E standard (Dwelling houses and flats) for airborne sound insulation and -5dB for impact sound insulation. The sound limiting insulation shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the approved retail unit and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers of the residential units, and neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and Ealing's interim SPG10: Noise and Vibration.
